intro: Sphalanthus caudatus, commonly known as the bearded goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, stiff hairs, contributing to its common name. Sphalanthus caudatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
